wikipedia_page.main: Professor Ronald Hinchcliffe (20 February 1926, Bolton –  5 January 2011, Hitchin) was a British audiovestibular physician and academic. He was a founding father of the speciality of audiological (audiovestibular) medicine, the systematic scientific study of disorders of hearing and balance.

link_mentions.page: Royal National Throat, Nose and Ear Hospital
response: *Professor Ronald Hinchcliffe was a consultant at the hospital in the 1960s, where he established a vestibular research laboratory.
